website_summaries.verdict: Toddlers and young children benefit from the use of oversized crayons like this set from Honeysticks.
pros: Uses 100% New Zealand beeswax and food grade pigments
Also available in thinner, longer sticks for older children and adults
cons: Crayons are short and thick, not easy for some children to hold
Color transfer is not always smooth

customer_reviews.title: Concerned about age of use
customer_reviews.text: This listing says for ages 1+, however these crayons are rather small and I am concerned they will be a choking hazard for my 1 year old. I obviously would only allow use with close supervision anyway, but kids do stick things in their mouths, it just happens. I noticed after the fact that elsewhere it says for ages 3+. This posting is misleading. I wonder if the "thick" version would be a better option for littler ones, but I am unsure how much larger they truly are. I will have to post the question and see what others say. I do like that these crayons are natural and non-toxic though.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Very deceiving
customer_reviews.text: So first off the picture is very deceiving, I thought they were going to be much bigger (thickness wise) second, they’re all chipped and colors are all over each other. Third, they gave me 2 whites and no black! What child colors with white? Lol overall they’re just not what I expected and they’re not in good shape. I will be sending them back ASAP and just sticking with making my own. I’m only giving it a second star bc they don’t stink like Crayola crayons
customer_reviews.author: Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I expected
customer_reviews.text: For 23$ we were expecting them to be a bit larger. My son is 11 months and he could easily choke on one of these. 23$ is a steep price to pay for a tiny box of small crayons
customer_reviews.author: Dallas

customer_reviews.title: my toddlers hate the crayons
customer_reviews.text: my toddlers hate it, they are very small and uncomfortable for them to hold, they hate the smell, had to press hard to get the color on paper and brake very easy, the price is ridiculous not worth it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Completely UNDERwhelming :(
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive these in the mail for my son. He is obsessed with coloring and has broken more jumbo crayons than I can count. I wanted something natural, chunky and virtually impossible to break. When I opened the package, I actually thought I received the wrong item! These are NOT big, chunky toddler crayons! They are way too small and not worth the amount of money I spent on them. Also, one of the crayons was BROKEN! I am completely underwhelmed and disappointed. I will be returning these and looking for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Sara H. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: TINYYYYY
customer_reviews.text: I read so many reviews of crayons for my one year old. I saw some pictures, I thought okay, short crayons are definitely fine, just need them to be wide. These honey sticks look good.. reviews say the colors are vibrant.. they look small in the adult’s hand, but I’m sure they’re much bigger in person.... ugh, $23, that’s a lot, but they’re safe and have great reviews. DISAPPOINTMENT when they came in. I can’t believe how tiny these are! Not chubby crayons at all. The pictures by the seller are so misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Its safe for kids! Buy now
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these! You can't put a price on safety. I got these when my daughter was about 18 months, shes now 2 and they're still going strong. They're easy to grab , colors are nice (don't expect super bright but they're still very noticeable). They seem to last very long as well so don't compare these to regular crayon prices. These are safe for your kids and they last. Try them out, they're great. P.s. it has eco friendly box.
customer_reviews.author: Hubish

customer_reviews.title: Chunky but be careful
customer_reviews.text: My son is almost 2yo., and he enjoys these fairly well. They are fat crayons, but can be a choking hazard, so we keep them out of reach when not in use and when unsupervised. There’s still a learning curve with my son and applying the right amount of pressure with the chunky crayon on the paper. I like the colors, they’re ok. Mostly I like that these are non toxic, and that my son can’t break them into pieces. He has drawn on the walls and cabinets, but the scribbles wipe away easily with a magic eraser. I don’t like the price point for these, $22 is steep.
customer_reviews.author: MommyK

customer_reviews.title: Finally a natural label tool for jars!
customer_reviews.text: Hi, Everyone. Have a blessed, healthy, and safe 2020. Finally I have a natural way to mark my jars/containers in my kitchen, since I refuse to use chemical laden markers, pens, etc. Works perfectly, either labeling jars on the glass and/or lid, as well as every-other container. Using a scrap piece of cloth to rub off ~ incredible use! No more falling out papers between lid/ring of jars (though it works) or tying string with paper tag around jar necks. Great to have a variety of colours depending on the background contents in the glass. Thank you, honeysticks for making this product.
customer_reviews.author: K & W

customer_reviews.title: NOT chubby crayons
customer_reviews.text: The pictures are incredibly deceiving. The entire box of crayons is smaller than a dollar bill. Each individual crayon is thinner than a quarter in diameter, 2 centimeters, and barely 2 inches long. Most of the ones in my box are puckered and wrinkled. I will be spending my nearly $25 on the Crayola egg shaped crayons instead. To add insult to injury they don't even smell nice :(
customer_reviews.author: Tamra

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. This is the first time I've ever bought crayons so I don't have much to compare them to, but I do feel like they draw kind of light. You have to press a bit harder to get the color to appear. It's fine for colors like green or dark red, but when you draw with the yellow, you really have to press, and my 17 month old doesn't quite get that concept yet. But I like the fact that they are non-toxic and easy to hold. They are kind of dirty since they're all packaged together without wrappers, so they kind of rub off on each other, but I don't think my kid minds :)
customer_reviews.author: TJB

customer_reviews.title: Best crayons ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best crayons ever!!! Very easy to draw or write for baby’s fingers. My son is 16 months and he enjoys drawing all over my “Picasso” sketches, lol. So cute! He can easily pick up the crayons with his little fingers. He refused to pick up any other crayons, or simply can’t because other crayons are just too thin. Love the fact that these are 100% natural beeswax and non-toxic. I can’t wait to hang up my baby’s creative finished products all over the walls like it’s his museum.
customer_reviews.author: SipsWithTips

customer_reviews.title: Ummmmm really tiny.
customer_reviews.text: Have been wanting these for a while but for 20 dollars they sure are small!! My hand is average size.
customer_reviews.author: Chitowngirl

customer_reviews.title: Creative crayons!
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are wonderful! -they’re thick and easy to grip. -materials nontoxic, natural honey. -variety of colors and different shades of some colors. -difficult for toddlers to break in half, which is a huge plus. However, they are expensive and smaller and shorter than I thought. Not a lot of “bang for your buck” type of crayon. Overall, I recommend these are perfect for training crayons!
customer_reviews.author: SAHM Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for small fingers and healthy minded Mamas
customer_reviews.text: Love these - the color is bright, they draw/color just like crayons, are thicker and easier to handle for small fingers, and thus do not break apart easily. No paper wrappers to get in the way. No smell of toxic colors like Crayola, and relief for a Mama who wants to mitigate the amount of toxicity in home, especially around baby. Highly recommend. In fact, 2 friends have already purchased and also love them. My daughter was 13 months old in this picture, easily coloring with these in hand. She LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: DGraham

customer_reviews.title: Choking Hazard
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are very small and are a potential choking hazard for any small child. I am shocked that they were advertised for ages 1+, be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F Calderon

customer_reviews.title: Fat Crayons are hard to find
customer_reviews.text: I like how round they are for his little 2 yr old hands being his first set of crayons. I dont like how short they are for the price. 25.00 I understand they are made from pure ingredients and he could probably eat them and be perfectly fine. I still would like a little more length on those crayons. I expected more for my money. You get 12 colors. They color well on ruff/textured coloring paper and construction paper.
customer_reviews.author: Ceo

customer_reviews.title: Is this a joke??! SO SMALL
customer_reviews.text: You’re kidding me. These are TINY y’all. It’s laughable how small these are for TODDLERS. I’ll compare to batteries!! 1 AA battery height with a little bit of the crayon tip being “longer” and slightly thicker than the but barely, definitely not the thickness of a size C battery. I’m trying to add a photo but it doesn’t give me an option. Would not recommend at this price. Love the concept, design and packaging but that’s it. What a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful!! I read some reviews about them being 'smelly' and what-not but I find the smell of them to be extremely pleasant! They are a bit tacky feeling and if you have pets that shed (like mine do) they will collect some hair on them. The short fat ones are the perfect size for my little guys hands. I will be ordering the 'thins' and 'longs' in the near future since my son loves these. They produce vibrant colors on paper which was one of my hesitations in purchasing a natural crayon.
customer_reviews.author: brittanylynn885

customer_reviews.title: Well drawing crayons - suitable for toddler
customer_reviews.text: Really solid, well drawing crayons - perfect for my toddler to begin coloring with. They write and draw well on construction paper and in the coloring book I purchased. I would even color with them myself if I didn't think that'd be a waste (since I need them for my little one). I love that they are made from a natural, edible substance - my only wish for improvement would be for the coloring to be made from non artificial dyes and instead come from foods as well. It was hard to find the exact information about the color ingredients, but from what I understand, they are made from artificial ingredients much like you'd find in food coloring.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Lague

customer_reviews.title: This works for first crayons
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for Grandson's first birthday, along with a coloring type of book. He seems to like the crayons, but mainly to pound together. That's his thing...pounding and beating on stuff. I think he's still to young to appreciate the act of coloring. These crayons don't have a ton of pigment in them so that's a little disappointing. Grandson does love to mouth them also, which I feel ok with because of their ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: Squrlee in Golden

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little hands!
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are PERFECT. The colours are varied and, well, colourful. They are the ideal size for little hands (not so long the hand slides down, not so thin they break). I saw some people saying they got dirty easily but these are still clean after many uses. They also smell amazing. I couldn’t have found better crayons. My one year old loves these as much as I do! Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: kittythepancake

customer_reviews.title: Don’t pay attention to negative reviews
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are fantastic for my 15 month old. Chunky style, easy to hold, the colors are vibrant on paper, and they crayons smell great! (They have a sweet honey/licorice smell which is not detectable unless you smell the actual crayon) My baby has no problem pressing the crayon into the paper and making marks. Maybe some others got older batches, but my crayons were soft and extremely easy to use. I would recommend these and definitely buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Sav

customer_reviews.title: Tiny and not dark enough
customer_reviews.text: The photo makes these look like large, fat crayons for a toddler. They are not; they are extremely tiny and I feel like I got ripped off for the price. They also write very lightly. My toddler can’t press hard enough to get the lighter colors to even appear on paper. While I’m sure these are more natural than Crayola, they’re not functional enough and are not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Big enough to hold and manipulate.
customer_reviews.text: I love these crayons. Big enough for my baby to hold and manipulate. The fact that it's made 100% out of beeswax makes it even better. I don't feel like it's too huge of a deal if baby accidentally swallows a speck that she bit off. Of course, don't leave your baby to play with these by her/himself, just like with anything else that is choking hazard.
customer_reviews.author: Irina

customer_reviews.title: Unbreakable Solution for Kids
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my granddaughter, and daughter, because my daughter told me how my granddaughter was breaking all her crayons and after hearing this I knew there had to be a solution. I found Honeysticks after doing a search on Amazon for unbreakable crayons. Although they are the most expensive crayons I have ever purchased, nothing is too expensive for my granddaughter (or daughter). I have heard from my daughter that she is no longer finding broken crayons around the house and that my granddaughter enjoys coloring with these. Thanks to Honeysticks for solving the broken crayon epidemic!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: Love these Crayons!
customer_reviews.text: These were a gift for my 13 month old granddaughter. Although she doesn’t quite know how to color yet..they were easy for her to hold in her hand as she scribbled lines in her coloring book. The colors were great they were not dull at all. And the fact they they are Honeysticks makes me happy to know they are safe if she attempts to put them in her mouth...which she did of course! She is learning her colors, hand eye coordination, and enjoying one on one time with mom. Can’t wait to see her first piece of artwork on the refrigerator!! I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Honey sticks
customer_reviews.text: These came very quickly and I like the size un fortunately my granddaughter right now at 1 years old likes to chew on everything lol but we are being careful with them and her that’s was my other reason for getting them as I feel they are safer for her if she does try to eat them
customer_reviews.author: Bunimac

customer_reviews.title: Rash & skin issue alert for Eczema allergic baby! Crayon is super tiny small
customer_reviews.text: My 7months old son got awful rash after he touched this crayon..... he has eczema but I never seen this horrible red rash all over his face. If your son or daughter has skin issue like eczema or allergy, be aware they can have skin irritation or rash!!!! It’s very expensive for very small size.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Calabrese

customer_reviews.title: Safe and fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my toddler after a lot of research into non toxic natural crayons. These took longer to arrive than expected but were worth the wait. The quality is excellent and they definitely feel natural. My 2 year old loves them and grips them very easily. The only cons I have are that they were a bit smaller than I expected and the colors weren't easy to tell apart until you start painting with them. Hence the 4 star instead of 5. They are pricey but I probably would buy again in the future for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: RossM

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: So far these seem to be really good. Yes they are pricy. They color ok. They are easy to hold given the thickness. Cannot comment on easy of removal on walls/paint since we have not encountered that yet. Happy we paid the extra bucks for natural components because baby is always putting them in his mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Nicely pigmented
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned buying these that they would be sticky and low pigmented since they are beeswax. But I haven’t experienced either of those issues so far in using them. They colors are all pretty vibrant and not at all sticky. They might not be as smooth as more conventional crayons but that doesn’t really bother me. My toddler is still trying to chew on them rather than color so I’m happy that they are all natural. They are a nice size for little hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting not honey sticky
customer_reviews.text: These last forever. Draw great with wonderful color. After almost a year, they haven’t broke, chipped or cracked. They clean off walls with a magic eraser, glass and stainless not so easy but doable with serious elbow grease. They pick up some dirt but are not sucky like honey, don’t let the name make you think they are a sticky mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: $22 for what?!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited about these. They looked great for my little one’s chubby hands. But buyer beware they are tiny! Felt like a complete rip off for the cost. Returning not worth $22.
customer_reviews.author: Monica L.

customer_reviews.title: I got 99 problems.... Ants being one!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I want to love these but unfortunately the ANTS love them too! Yes, ants, as in bugs. They're called Honey Sticks after all, so why wouldn't ants love them? They smell like honey. They're beautiful and definitely unique but seriously? Ants... Ugh come on. I got enough problems without trying to keep ants off my kid's crayons. They are easy to hold, lovely colors, very smooth, smell delicious... But therein lies the problems folks.
customer_reviews.author: VMH

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to color with
customer_reviews.text: Child has to press too hard. I felt good about buying these for my daughter at about a ten months old. She liked holding them. And she would draw around on the paper but it was frustrating for her because it took so much pressure to draw a line. So mostly she just ended up pretending to color with these. At 16 months I got here large washable crayola crayons. She is having lots more fun with those.
customer_reviews.author: Holden's Person

customer_reviews.title: No more nervous mama!
customer_reviews.text: I love these crayons! My 2yo loves to eat crayons and Because these are made of beeswax I’m not nervous about it. I used to watch her like a hawk, constantly pulling crayons out of her mouth and trying to no avail to get her to stop. Now at least I know that her color time snacks are safe for
customer_reviews.author: R. B.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price for ease of use and beautiful colors
customer_reviews.text: My toddler loves to chew crayons so I wanted something safe for her to gnaw on and color with! As soon as I opened these she was all over them, happily coloring. They fit perfectly in her little hands and she doesn’t even chew them now! Love that they are natural but the beeswax smell is fairly strong. For a natural product the colors are beautiful and the crayons draw very smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda S Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Intense Colors
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are great, colors are intense, transfer easily to paper not like cheap waxy crayons, and there is a good variety of colors in the box. Easy for my 3 year old to use. Only downside: feels somewhat sticky when you hold these which might bother some people.
customer_reviews.author: Elsbeth

customer_reviews.title: Amazing crayons!
customer_reviews.text: Love this idea. It’s amazing! What young child doesn’t want to eat crayons. These are safe and color really well with vibrant colors. They are perfect for my two years old little hand. I thought they would be bigger but makes sense to have them a little smaller for the kiddos.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: overpriced and the colors are not flattering
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact it is safe and non-toxic but i am not sure whether the price is worth it. it is very hard to draw on paper, and the colors are not nice. they are quite dark and I got the same dark blue and dark brown colors. (only 12 in the box so i literally just have 8 colors)
customer_reviews.author: L F

customer_reviews.title: Good crayons
customer_reviews.text: Original set of creations arrived broken and in shards but after requesting an exchange, we immediately received a new set that were all intact. These creations smell lovely which is actually a double-edged sword because our son tries to take a bite each time he uses them to color.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect works of art
customer_reviews.text: Happy that this is a eco nontoxic crayon considering my little one has attempted to eat them. However, they aren't that great for drawing. The amount of pressure that has to be applied to get a decent amount of pigment on the paper is beyond him, he's 18mo for reference. I think it has to do with the wax consistency. So great for practice but not for real drawing.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: We love having safe crayons for our daughter
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for our 16-month-old daughter who loves to chew on crayons. We still only use these under careful supervision, but we feel much better about those inevitable times when she does get the crayon in her mouth. The size is perfect for tender little hands, and they smell wonderful. Definitely worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: JJPL

customer_reviews.title: Some pros, some cons
customer_reviews.text: Yes, these crayons are itty bitty but the color payoff is more vibrant than I expected. For $23 it's peace of mind when she decides she'd like to nibble a chunk off. There are also two crayons that appear yellow.. One is slightly darker, but they could have included another color like purple instead.
customer_reviews.author: EB800

customer_reviews.title: Maybe better for under 2...which doesn’t make sense
customer_reviews.text: These aren’t great and over priced. Got my son these for Christmas. He’s 20 months. He was trying to eat the crayola brand crayons so I got him these. The colors are faint when he uses them. You have to have a strong/heavy hand to use them. They are sticky too. He doesn’t like them at all. Waste of $30
customer_reviews.author: Heathelovesamazon

customer_reviews.title: Great first set of crayons
customer_reviews.text: My LO loves these crayons! He is 13 months and already was interested in coloring so after looking through options these won. They are easy to grip and the color shows up well. The coloring got a little ambitious and something was colored that was not supposed to be. . . If that happens magic eraser is the way to go but it took some scrubbing!
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate

customer_reviews.title: Good crayons but smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with everything except the size of the crayons. I thought that they would be larger. They are 2 inches tall and three quarter inches wide. I had expected them to be longer. They smell great and work well with my 15 month old's chubby hands.
customer_reviews.author: K. Elisabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great crayons if your little wont try to eat them
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of these crayons, and if my 1-year-old wasn’t desperate to eat them they’d be perfect. But he can’t keep them out of his mouth. He’s obsessed with biting them. He bites off chunks and holds them in his mouth. Maybe when he gets a bit older these will be good for art, but for now he’s too mouthy for these crayons.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Somewhat Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I should have looked at more of the pictures as we were very surprised to see just how small (short) these were. They are great to have, as opposed to regular crayons, when you have a 16 month old that is going to be ujsing them, but I think that they could be longer.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Sweebe

customer_reviews.title: Smell great, safe for kids, colors are very pale though
customer_reviews.text: I think this is a great concept, however the colors are very very pale. My toddler can barely see what he is painting.. you need to put a lot of pressure while drawing. however I’m not too worried when he puts these in his mouth and tries to chew on them.
customer_reviews.author: Tina F.

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 7 month old because I wanted to start introducing her to art without her inadvertently poisoning herself. $20 seems like a lot, but I just saw an article about dollar store crayons containing asbestos. She can easily hold them and instantly wants to draw after she sees dad with them.
customer_reviews.author: Conscious Father

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: They are small to adult or older child but it fit my 18 month old very well. I love the smell, little one did want to taste them at first but she got over that desire. The colors are great and well pigmented They do have a slightly tacky feel but again it’s beeswax so it’s worth it knowing it’s all real product
customer_reviews.author: Leeora08

customer_reviews.title: Mixed Feelngs
customer_reviews.text: I am conflicted about these crayons. Pros- non toxic and natural, great smell, nice variety of colors Cons - EXPENSIVE, smaller than I expected I'm torn as to whether I would buy them again. Honestly, I probably would simply because there is no other option for natural crayons that I could find.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Sockriter

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little hands
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my grand daughter who is 18 months old. She loves them to scribble with. I was worried about them smelling too sweet like honey, as it would be too tempting to want to taste. This is not the case, they have a nice scent and not a lot of pressure is needed for them to make a mark, colors are vibrant. Perfect for little hands !
customer_reviews.author: Yogibare

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: These are smaller than the pictures make them appear. Unused these are 2 1/8 inches long and 2 1/2 inches around. This makes them not only a disappointment for the price, but the exact right size for a choking hazard. I would not recommend these delicious smelling/ tasting crayons to anyone with a child who still puts things in their mouth. For those old enough not to do this, there are better and more satisfying options.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Dull colors.  Overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: Colors are dull. Sticks wear down quickly with each use. Harder to clean from surfaces than regular crayons. Sticks are VERY short - more so than they appear in photos, but the width is perfect for my 8mo old. Thankfully they are nontoxic & have no plastic smell, but they still feel overpriced for the poor coloring functionality.
customer_reviews.author: Shayla

customer_reviews.title: Not so great color selection
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea. They crayons are actually really good quality! Just not a fan of the colors. Half of the box consists of brown/yellowish colors. And a white crayon, really? For how expensive these crayons are, I just wish they had a better color selection! They are made for young children. Young kids like bright colors!
customer_reviews.author: D in FL

customer_reviews.title: Love but I wish they were longer
customer_reviews.text: These are great! My son loves to draw with them and I don’t have to stress much about him putting them in his mouth since they’re made of beeswax(he’s 18 months old so it happens). I do wish they were longer tho. I like that they’re thick but they’re very short so there’s not much crayon and I don’t see them lasting long if used in a daily basis. Being longer would also help with them not easily going in the mouth because at the current size, they easily fit in my sons mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda C

customer_reviews.title: Great crayons
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are a great size for my 19 month old grandson to hold. So far he hasn’t been able to break them, which is a welcome change. They color nicely & the colors are great. I like the fact that they are non-toxic. All of which makes them worth every penny to me. I will definitely purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Kemerer

customer_reviews.title: Non-Toxic Honeysticks
customer_reviews.text: Expensive for what you get! The crayons are shorter than I anticipated and had very little scent to them. It is nice to know they are made strictly of non-toxic dyes and beeswax.
customer_reviews.author: DJH

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good crayons. I appreciate that they don't have a paper label. One less thing to have to keep my kid from eating 🤣 The colors are somewhat muted, but I can respect that since they are made with food safe dye.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Good crayons
customer_reviews.text: They are the perfect size for a toddler's hands. They do have a bit of a stickiness which makes sense because they're made of been wax. My only complaint is when they came there was little bits that had chuncked off and we're sticking all over the other colors, but I wiped them off a little bit and they don't seem to be falling apart anymore.
customer_reviews.author: MrsH2O

customer_reviews.title: Safe for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I was expecting, one of the crayons is split down the middle when I opened the box. Bummer! Package was fine. Just a defective crayon. I do however like the concept of beeswax crayons for my toddler who wants to color yet tastes everything he gets his hands on.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Abner

customer_reviews.title: Lovely safe coloring for toddler
customer_reviews.text: These were definitely more pricey than regular Crayola brand products. However, I know my son and he will chew on everything. With that in mind I was happy to find these at all. They have beautiful colors that are rich and visible even of brown cardboard.
customer_reviews.author: Karolina K.

customer_reviews.title: Small but functional
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than anticipated both length and width. A little tough for my 12month old to hold onto- especially given that they're made of beeswax. Great colors. Smell natural. And little nibbled don't seem to be making her belly upset.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy unless you want semi-permanent art
customer_reviews.text: These color easy and I like that they are short because my little one tends to break the bath crayons that are longer. However, they are a nightmare to clean off your tile/tub and for this reason alone I will not be repurchasing and can’t recommend. Do not buy unless you feel like you want a unique new arm workout or something because you’ll be scrubbing forever. And yes, I have tried a variety of solutions/brushes/sponges.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Yousefzadeh

customer_reviews.title: Durable, but poor color-quality, and don't smell of beeswax
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are durable, which I really like...but they have poor color quality. When using them, you have to press harder to get color, and the color that comes out is "thinner" (kind of like roseart, but not as bad), and the hues themselves are rather dull. These also don't smell much like beeswax. I do wonder what other waxes they used to make these crayons...
customer_reviews.author: AaronNicole

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They are perfect size for my children and the fact that they are on the safer side, for the kids you are teaching to color, and end up just eating crayons. Love them. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing
customer_reviews.text: These crayons are small and dull colors. My pack seemed old and banged up. Especially since the price is double the suggested retail price. If I am paying a premium, I expect to get a well cared for product. Not something that looks like they pulled it out of a dusty old closet.
customer_reviews.author: Nobody

customer_reviews.title: Great crayons for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: We have other crayons but they break often and we are fed up of having a million small pieces to pick up. We were looking for a better alternative and found honeysticks. Nice selection of colors, applies smoothly to paper and their pigmentation is great. The stubby crayon is easy to hold and we are happy it's safe if put in the mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Filip P.

customer_reviews.title: Weird texture
customer_reviews.text: My toddler just wants to eat these, and they are a bit sticky on the outside, which makes them collect lint and dust and pet hair really easily. It washes off, but kind of a pain. I actually wish they had some sort of paper wrapper. They do smell wonderful though, and are a nice size.
customer_reviews.author: olgavrealtor

customer_reviews.title: Waxy when held in hand; evenso great product overall!
customer_reviews.text: I like the product I got. While they are slightly smaller than u imagined, they still fit the bill. Comforted by the fact that they are bees wax, especially since the little one thinks everything is edible. Doesn’t mean I allow it when I see it, but if I get distracted for a bit, I don’t feel guilty about these honeysticks being tasted.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little hands, but hard to get color to show up unless pressed firm
customer_reviews.text: We love how simple these crayons are with no paper on the outside of the crayon, chubby for chubby little hands, and so many colors! I don't love that they are hard to make show up for little toddlers just learning to color (I feel like you have to press down pretty firm in order to see the color on a coloring book), but we will get lots of use out of them and that will change as she gets bigger! It's a little steep in price for crayons, but we are super happy with them overall- and they smell great! :)
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Morey

customer_reviews.title: Love the concept
customer_reviews.text: We haven't used them yet (Christmas gift) but I love the concept. The crayons look short enough to not be overwhelming for a child (won't poke himself in the eye, for example) but wide enough for small hands to grip well. The array of colors is great. They come in a cute little package -- easy for parents to store in between drawings. I couldn't find any other crayons so clean and safe elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Aurore G.

customer_reviews.title: Awful packaging
customer_reviews.text: Items arrived completely outside of the packaging and the box was crushed. They had clearly smashed up against one another and bits of various colors are on all of the crayons. Terrible packaging/delivery. Otherwise an okay product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gourley

customer_reviews.title: Started off well...
customer_reviews.text: So I love that these crayons are made from beeswax and they color nicely. What I don't love is that since they do not have the requisite wrapping around the middle the crayons get kind of nasty. I'm sure its a mixture of dirt from hands and being flung around but since this is normal small child behavior the product needs to be able to stand up to it.
customer_reviews.author: Chaz

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on non-toxic crayons for my baby. I am very happy to have found Honeysticks! These are great! Much better than I expected! Perfect size for my 15 mo. They color on paper well and smell yummy! The reason for 4 stars is that I wish there was another color other than white and the two yellow colors are almost identical.
customer_reviews.author: K. Beck

customer_reviews.title: Kind of Pricey but Excellent for Little Hands
customer_reviews.text: This is a great introduction to crayons. Very easy for little hans to hold and impossible to break. These are the most expensive crayons I've ever purchased, but because of their durability they may be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Allen

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Our 14 month old was able to hold them without an issue and they color beautifully! The colors are vibrant and do not require pressing into paper in order to draw with them. The one downside is one crayon of the 12 arrived broken (I doubt a shipping issue as the box was completely intact as were all other items in the box). I didn’t want to return all of them and Amazon offered a partial credit which was a fair compromise for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: They are harder to color with than regular crayons. The child has to press down harder to make marks on a page. The size is great for small hands. Much easier to hold than regular fat crayons. The colors are vibrant.
customer_reviews.author: MS

customer_reviews.title: Easy to hold
customer_reviews.text: My 15 mo old can hold these crayons with ease. She has a little problem pressing down on the coloring book to actually color...so she is still learning. She has no problem putting them in her mouth...
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Smith

customer_reviews.title: Honey smell makes it appetizing for my toddler to eat!
customer_reviews.text: These are a perfect size and work like normal crayons. I also like that they are nontoxic and made of food grade materials. But they smell like honey and this encourages my kid and dog to chew on them!
customer_reviews.author: Elly W.

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: This is my fault for not paying attention to the size/description but be aware these are very small. That being said I'm happy to have a natural option for my baby to explore with and not worry if it goes in her mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Alli

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality - Buy them!
customer_reviews.text: These are fabulous. Fat little crayons easy for littles without refined fine motor skills to grip. They color just as well as Crayola. Love them and will buy again. I hope they make them in a regular size for when she’s older. I cannot think of anything critical to say about these.
customer_reviews.author: DaBearsGal

customer_reviews.title: hard to clean after  use!
customer_reviews.text: Hard to take it off from floor; It stick on it! and it is a job to clean! Th e good thing it is non toxic! my child eat a piece, accidentally, and he doesn't has allergic reaction or nothing! thanks for that! it doesn't break as faster than others and has a good size for a toddler hand.
customer_reviews.author: bellaflor

customer_reviews.title: Good, safe starter crayons
customer_reviews.text: Really like that these are beeswax. I don't worry as much if my happens to nibble on it for a second. Color and smell is great! Reason for 4 stars is the crayons came in slightly beat up. One of them was split in half. Not a huge deal but a little disappointing considering the price I paid for them.
customer_reviews.author: Emma G

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love these crayons for my 1 year old. They are the perfect size for her to be able to hold, they are vibrant crayons, and the best part is if she decides to chew on one I don't really need to worry about it since they are all natural. When I first opened them I was skeptical because they are small and come in a very small box but they turned out to be the perfect size. Plus they smell pretty good. I will be purchasing more of these crayons in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Vdaily

customer_reviews.title: Too sticky
customer_reviews.text: The Honey sticks become too sticky within minutes of child using. Cannot leave unattended for a second due to small size (choking hazard) The Sticks are not good for a child that has tactile issues. The stickiness is a complete turn off.
customer_reviews.author: AnnJ

customer_reviews.title: Very small!
customer_reviews.text: For the price I wasn’t expecting them to be micro. They are maybe 1.5 inches in length. I wish they had one of those scaled photos of the hand holding it so show actual size.
customer_reviews.author: Bora I.

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful packaging but extremely small for the price
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful packaging but extremely small for the price. I know they’re supposed to fit into little hands but they are seriously tiny. I guess I’m supposed to feel better about the price because my child can eat them and not die but i definitely imagined them being bigger. I’ll be interested to learn how long they last
customer_reviews.author: Chalsey Symonds

customer_reviews.title: Beeswax.
customer_reviews.text: Nice for gripping. Colors are a little bland to be honest. A couple of same color crayons. My daughter loves sniffing them. They smell like beeswax. She has fun coloring with them. I leave a giant pad out for her to color when the mood strikes her.
customer_reviews.author: Bride2be

customer_reviews.title: Good crayons for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Good to know these are not toxic if my toddler or dogs take a nibble at them (which they have all done). They color fairly well, good enough for toddlers. Once my daughter is old enough to color more detailed pictures I'll probably want to find some better crayons, but these are great for now.
customer_reviews.author: WRPmom52716

customer_reviews.title: Great safe alternative to the nasty big name brands
customer_reviews.text: We love these! Easy to hold and use, they smell good, they write well. They do leave hands a little sticky, but so do all other crayons we used without a wrapper around them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey S. Tatem

customer_reviews.title: Best crayons for baby!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these! No smell, no break colors show up dark and nice! My one year old daughter got them from us for her birthday! And I'm more than satisfied well worth the price!!!! I'm an occupational therapist and there is so many great developmental benefits with these!!! Color recognition, hand-eye coordination, palmer grasp and sensory.....oh the list goes on! Can you tell I love these!!! Haha
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: This product is not worth the money. My 22 month old prefers coloring with regular size crayons. I could have just bought Crayola at Walmart instead of this unnecessary item. These crayons don't have much pigment either.
customer_reviews.author: Caligirl818

customer_reviews.title: Good but dirt sticks to them
customer_reviews.text: Love these for my 16 month old. However dirt will stick to them. And my little one likes to roll them on the floor. So if you have pets, then pet hair will stick to them. This is easy for my little one to hold. Perfect size for her hands.
customer_reviews.author: Beachbummama

customer_reviews.title: Anything for that baby!
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price, I was expecting a box of big, fat crayons, similar to the size of jumbo pieces of chalk. They’re not. A little disappointed but I am keeping them for Christmas. The quality seems great. They are cute and I’ll probably end up ordering them again for my grandson.
customer_reviews.author: MAK

customer_reviews.title: Natural ingredients
customer_reviews.text: A little shorter than I had anticipated but I like the smell and the color is nice. I am happy they are more natural than crayola. My 18 month old loves to color with them.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Great crayons!
customer_reviews.text: Great variety of colors, chunky for toddler fingers to grasp & best of all, non toxic. The kids actually love the smell & we keep it in its own cute box that it came in.
customer_reviews.author: RLjr

product_meta.title: Honeysticks 100% Pure Beeswax Crayons Natural, Safe for Toddlers, Kids and Children, Handmade in New Zealand, for 1 Year Plus (12 Pack)
feature_bullets: NATURAL NON TOXIC GOODNESS - Honeysticks beeswax crayons are handmade using 100% pure New Zealand beeswax and Food Grade Pigments for Color. They are safe for infants, kids and children of all ages. Contains no paraffin wax or cheap fillers.

DURABLE & ERGONOMIC SHAPE - The unique chubby shape of Honeysticks makes them easier for small hands to hold, but much harder for small hands to break! Honeysticks have been "tested in preschools and the kids have tried to break them but they just can't. Plus they love the smell!" Each crayon is 55mm long and 20mm diameter.

SUSTAINABLE & LOW IMPACT - The beeswax used to create Honeysticks is a natural by-product of honey production. This sustainable process causes minimal impact on the environment and gives the crayons a wonderful honey scent.

12 EXCITING COLORS - Let your little ones express their inner artist with a stunning range of twelve eye catching, crayon colors. Crayon material easily bonds to the paper, poster or artboard. Free Coloring Book PDF Download with Purchase

MONEY BACK GUARANTEE - If you're not 100% happy with your 12 Pack of natural beeswax crayons and their delightful New Zealand honey scent, simply return them for a no questions asked full refund. No risk, no fuss! The more Honeysticks you buy the more you save.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,648 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
